django.utils.jslex

JsLex: a lexer for JavaScript

Classes

Tok

A specification for a token class.

Lexer

A generic multi-state regex-based lexer.

JsLexer

A JavaScript lexer

Create a regex from a space-separated list of literal choices.

prepare_js_for_gettext(js)

Convert the JavaScript source js into something resembling C for

django.utils.jslex.literals(choices, prefix='', suffix='')[source]

Create a regex from a space-separated list of literal choices.

If provided, prefix and suffix will be attached to each choice individually.

class django.utils.jslex.Lexer(states, first)[source]

A generic multi-state regex-based lexer.

lex(text)[source]

Lexically analyze text.

Yield pairs (name, tokentext).

class django.utils.jslex.JsLexer[source]

Bases: Lexer

A JavaScript lexer

>>> lexer = JsLexer()
>>> list(lexer.lex("a = 1"))
[('id', 'a'), ('ws', ' '), ('punct', '='), ('ws', ' '), ('dnum', '1')]

This doesn’t properly handle non-ASCII characters in the JavaScript source.

both_before[source]
both_after[source]
states[source]
django.utils.jslex.prepare_js_for_gettext(js)[source]

Convert the JavaScript source js into something resembling C for xgettext.

What actually happens is that all the regex literals are replaced with “REGEX”.
